g.text: • is registered at the AS as a confidential client and has a client secret
• is registered at the AS as a confidential client and has a client secret
a) issues an opaque Access Token using a high entropy nonce data string
b) maps the corresponding client secrets to the issued token and stores the token data in a database
• generates the Route-JWT with a payload including the Access Token, issuer and a timestamp
• generates the next Route-JWT with a compound payload
• a new required claim {"iss":client name} must be added to the previous Route-JWT payload as a nested object
to form a new compound payload
• the nested object may contain additional optional claims e.g., "resource_id", "resource_scopes"
payload = base64url encoded [previous Route-JWT payload(Route-JWT payload)]
message = base64url decoded previous Route-JWT signature
RS sends the Route-JWT in the Authorization header
to authenticate itself to the AS introspection endpoint
a) looks up the Access Token data using the token claim value from the Route-JWT, and checks the token state
b) reconstructs an Itinerary-JWT using the Route-JWT payload data, token data and corresponding client secrets
c) compares the Itinerary-JWT signature with the Route-JWT signature, they are equal,
the Access Token route and the Route-JWT have been verified,
the AS validates the ts (timestamp) claim value from the Route-JWT, if valid,
the AS may return the Access Token introspection response
• verifies the Access Token introspection response, if true,
the RS may return the protected resource
